and.paletteHelp: This node does a boolean and on all inputs.
and.help:
This node does a boolean and on all inputs.

All states are saved and restored upon restart of Homegear.
and.output1Description: Outputs the result of the boolean comparison.

change.paletteHelp: Set, change, delete or move properties of a message, flow context or global context.
change.help:
Set, change, delete or move properties of a message, flow context or global context.

The node can specify multiple rules that will be applied in the order they are defined.

Details

The available operations are:

Set
set a property. The value can be a variety of different types, or can be taken from an existing message or context property.
Change
search & replace parts of the property. If regular expressions are enabled, the "replace with" property can include capture groups, for example $1. Replace will only change the type if there is a complete match.
Delete
delete a property.
Move
move or rename a property.

fallingedge.paletteHelp: The input message is forwarded when the input is evaluated to false. An input evaluated to true is ignored.
fallingedge.help:
The input message is forwarded when the input is evaluated to false.

An input evaluated to true is ignored.
fallingedge.output1Description: The input message when the input is evaluated to false.

not.paletteHelp: Converts an input to bool and negates it.
not.help: This node converts an input to bool and negates it.
not.output1Description: Outputs the result of the boolean operation.

or.paletteHelp: This node does a boolean or on all inputs.
or.help:
This node does a boolean or on all inputs.

All states are saved or restored upon restart of Homegear.
or.output1Description: Outputs the result of the boolean comparison.

risingedge.paletteHelp: The input message is forwarded when the input is evaluated to true. An input evaluated to false is ignored.
risingedge.help:
The input message is forwarded when the input is evaluated to true.

An input evaluated to false is ignored.
risingedge.output1Description: The input message when the input is evaluated to true.

srflipflop.help: This node outputs true when the S input is set to true. It also outputs false when the R input is set to true. An input of false is ignored on both inputs.
srflipflop.output1Description: Outputs the result of the SR flip flop.

label.output-true: Output "true" instead of forwarding the message

switch.paletteHelp: Route messages based on their property values or the value of a second input.
switch.help:
Route messages based on their property values or the value of a second input.

Details

When a message arrives, the node will evaluate each of the defined rules and forward the message to the corresponding outputs of any matching rules.

Optionally, the node can be set to stop evaluating rules once it finds one that matches.

Also optionally the node can output true and false instead of forwarding the input payload.

label.name: Name
label.output-true: Output "true" instead of forwarding the message

variable-switch.paletteHelp: Route messages based on the value of a variable.
variable-switch.help:
Route messages based on the value of a variable.

Details

When a message arrives, the node reads the value of the specified variable. It then evaluates this value using each of the defined rules and forward the message to the corresponding outputs of any matching rules.

Optionally, the node can be set to stop evaluating rules once it finds one that matches.

Also optionally the node can output true, false or a static value instead of forwarding the input payload.
